Ref Table(s).19: PPDM_PROCEDUREPPDM_SYSTEM PPDM_TABLEPPDM_INDEX PPDM_COLUMNPPDM_CODE_VERSIONPPDM_CONSTRAINT

Column Comment.0: STATUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the status of an object that is beingtracked, usually a system object such as a constraint or procedure. However, objectsmay also be business rules. Intended to support management of objects used in datamanagement functions.
Column Comment.1: STATUS OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the status of an object.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CODE VERSION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number identifying the versionof the reference value that is stored in this table.
Column Comment.4: CODE VERSION SOURCE: the source for this reference code version.
Column Comment.5: COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found in the PPDMschema
Column Comment.6: CONSTRAINT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a primary, foreign, check or otherconstraint.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the association between the column and the groupcame into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the association between the column and the group wasno longer in effect.
Column Comment.9: INDEX IDENTIFIER: unique ID for the index.
Column Comment.10: OBJECT NAME: the identifier or name assigned to the object.
Column Comment.11: PPDM OBJECT STATUS: The current status of the object, such as enabled ordisabled.
Column Comment.12: PPDM OBJECT TYPE: The type of database object that is being tracked, such as atable, column, index, constraint or procedure.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: PROCEDURE IDENTIFIER: Identifier for procedures used for a system or table. Maybe a stored procedure, called procedure, function etc.
Column Comment.15: TABLE PROPERTY CONTROL SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the propertycontrol information. This can be used to help you control how a vertical table isimplemented, by determining preferred units of measure, data entry types and otherspecifications for each kind of property that is defined.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: RULE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a rule. Rules may be policies, practices,procedures or system business rules.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.20: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
